meanings.definition: Not worthy of trust or confidence; unreliable.
meanings.sent1: He is an untrustworthy person who always breaks promises.
meanings.sent2: The salesman seemed untrustworthy, so I didn't buy anything from him.
meanings.sent3: The untrustworthy weather forecast predicted sunshine, but it rained all day.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as untrustworthy as a snake's charm.
meanings.sent5: The untrustworthy bridge swayed dangerously in the wind.

meanings.definition: Not to be relied on or trusted.
meanings.sent1: The untrustworthy website was full of false information.
meanings.sent2: She found his excuses untrustworthy and decided to end the relationship.
meanings.sent3: The untrustworthy clock kept changing the time randomly.
meanings.sent4: His untrustworthy promises were like sand slipping through fingers.
meanings.sent5: The untrustworthy path led them into a dark, eerie forest.
